name: Holiday Inn Express Santa Barbara

reviews.title: Great find. Loved it!
reviews.text: My wife and I (in our 40's, but hip) stayed here on a Saturday and Sunday night (December 2-3). We loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is fantastic. Right off of State st (the main drag) within a one minute walk of several restaurans and a few minutes form many more and shopping galore (did a lot of Christmas shopping), yet only 10-15 minute walk from the pier.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Price-$216/night over Thanksgiving, rooms not soundproof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was excellent. They were all professional, friendly and extremely accommodating. I wish we had gotten all of their names, but I do remember Joyce (who did the excellent continental breakfast well-stocked with fresh omelettes, and got bottled water for my wife each morning) and Jose at the front desk who went out of his way to get us directions.
reviews.title: Stay away from room 212

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and well decorated, with nice painted-brick interior. We took the advice of other Tripadvisors and got a 3rd (top) floor room in the back of the hotel (room 309) and it was very quiet, except for someone coming in and out of the exit door at our end of the hallway at two o'clock in the morning on Saturday). The room also has windows on two sides which open to provide fresh Santa Barbara air to us East coasters.
reviews.title: bad value for the money

reviews.text: We will certainly be back!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in the centre of Santa Barbara
Good Location
reviews.text: This holiday inn did have parking which was great if it wasnt full all the time.

reviews.title: Good location to enjoy Santa Barbara
reviews.text: Breakfast was not great. Location good near the main street. Easy to get around to eat and shop. Nothing stands out too much for me on this hotel. It wasnt overly great but it wasnt overly bad either.

reviews.title: Good hotel near the main street
reviews.text: Location, location! This Holiday Inn Express is at the center of the Santa Barbara universe. 1/2 a block from State St., which has places to eat, shop and bars. In ten minutes you can be at the beach or on the wharf. The Amtrak terminal is down the street if you choose to travel that way. although you don't hear the trains if you are on the first floor. Parking is not plentiful so be early! The staff however does a good job getting the most out of the parking spaces. Our room was nice, clean and the free internet was nice to use. The staff always tried to help and were friendly. They have a, "good neighbor policy" that you have to sign. It's a good thing because the walls are not very soundproof. The hallways also can be noisy depending on who is staying at the hotel. Overall we would give this hotel an above rating.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: The hotel exceeded my already high expectation from reading the tripadvisor reviews. It is right next to the State Street, where all the activities are and is four blocks from the beach.

reviews.title: A slightly different Holiday Inn Express
reviews.text: Our room was on the third floor with two large French windows/semi-balcony opening to a great distant view of the mountains. Street noise was minimal, room was on the small side but functional, nice flat screen TV, comfy bed. Room offered complementary wi-fi internet connection. Parking was $7. Breakfast was mediocre.

Great Location. Just a short walk to many good resturants and shopping. Probably to far a walk ( and I like to walk) to the pier down at the beach front. Rooms clean and comfortable. Good value for a multi-night stay in Santa Barbara.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located 1 block from State Street, the main boulevard in historic downtown, the location is excellent for walking. Within a few blocks, there's tons of shops, restaurants, and the pier.
reviews.title: Great Location & Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was just remodeled, it's actually a historic hotel with a lot of character, yet everything is nicely updated.
reviews.title: Wonderfulstay!

likes.liked: — access to beach and State St.

reviews.text: -Good Value for price
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Great Location
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.disliked: — No business center, lack of parking

reviews.title: Bait and switch
reviews.text: The hotel advertises a "summer special" rate through its website. I e-mailed as instructed on the website, but received no reply. When I followed up with a phone call a week later, I was told that I could not recieve the discounted rate because only a few rooms were left. When I asked if I could receive the rate because I had e-mailed earlier, when more rooms likely would have been available, the receptionist had the nerve to tell me that I should not have e-mailed and should have called instead, even though the website invites e-mail reservations. She went on to say that the manager had probably declined to reply to my e-mail because there were no rooms available.
I'll take my business elsewhere.
reviews.title: Careful of the 1st floor

reviews.text: Hotel location is quite convenient to main downtown shopping district. We were there during a spanish festival and the streets were alive with people and things to do. The room decorations, furnishings and amenities are very nice, definitely quite a bit nicer than your average Holiday Inn Express. My big complaint with this hotel was noise. Our room was on the first floor and right next to the parking lot. Surprisingly we had no problems with car noise, but the view was not very nice! However we heard noise from everywhere else. The hallway and doors and walls let in quite a bit of noise, and most annoyingly the room above created a tremendous racket from people jsut wlking on the floor. The floor had a squeek that happened with every apparent step. I have stayed in many hotels and this was by far the noisiest room I have ever been in.
reviews.title: Nice and convenient
Great Location - Great Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and were pleasantly surprised. The room looked newly refurbished with exposed bricks on one wall, a small refrigerator, and microwave plus the other usual stuff (TV, hair dryer, coffee maker). It supposedly had free wireless Internet but we did not use it. Parking was an additional $7 for us. Our room was small but nicely appointed and faced the parking lot. We had a 3rd floor room which was nice - although I could only imagine that having a ground floor room next to a parking lot (cars were literally parked next to the room windows) would not have been nice!

reviews.title: Convenient, nice staff
reviews.text: The continental breakfast was adequate and had the usual bagels, muffins, danishes, etc. Hotels in Santa Barbara are pricey and this is no exception. But it was very convenient to downtown which is what we wanted.

aka: Holiday Inn Express Santa Barbara Hotel Santa Barbara
description: Just a half block from State Street in historic Old Town Santa Barbara, the Holiday Inn Express Hotel Virginia provides luxury and convenience for the sophisticated traveler. Enjoy a complimentary hot breakfast served daily from 6:30AM-9:30AM daily. Downtown shopping and restaurants are steps from your door, and the beach and Stearn's Wharf are four blocks away.
